Description: Left hand from relief: the left hand faces right and includes most of the wrist. Originally it was moulded in one piece with either the entire arm or a section of it as this fragment has clearly been broken from a larger composition. The glass is opaque turquoise-blue with a glossy surface. The elongated treatment of the fingers and the fine work suggest an origin within the reign of Akhenaten.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.37, pp.36-37)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
